strow.stentry: If set to true, displays just above the table/tree a small icon that allows users to expand/collapse nodes of the tree. This icon is displayed only if grouping has been defined.
If set to true, displays just above the table/tree a small icon that allows users to show/hide existing columns in the table/tree.

If set to true, displays two labels in the table/tree toolbar: Select all and Deselect all. These labels allows users to select/deselect all nodes of the table. These labels will only be generated when there is a table with a placeholder column marked as checkbox.

If set to true, displays an icon with an event. This event will display a filter layer that allows users to choose extra filters to apply to the table. All domain columns marked as "Is part of the filter" will be available for filtering. To finalize the display of the filter layer, a page and a pageflow is necessary. This pageflow will be used as a sub-pageflow in the main pageflow where it is possible for the WUI end user to define the filter.
Applies when multiple placeholder columns containing checkboxes are designed within the table. If set to true, selecting one checkbox deselects all other checkboxes on the same row.
When set to true, the Width and Height properties can be set to limit the boundaries of the table.

The maximum number of rows to display. If set to the keyword Corporate, then the value is retrieved from the corporate design (see section ); otherwise, it must be a valid number. Note: The value 0 (zero) means no pagination and the table footer below the table will not be displayed.
The number of rows to display within Design Studio. This has no effect on the actual running of the application.
Highlights the row that the user hovers with the mouse.
Displays on each tree node the number of items listed under it.
This is the editable dataset attached to the underlying table.
This is an attribute of the editable dataset that uniquely identifies an entity.
This is an attribute of the dataset (format) that bounds the enclosing module. Its value uniquely identifies a row in the table.

This is a boolean attribute of the dataset (format) that is bound to the module that contains the table. It is used at runtime to allow/disallow the editing of a row/value according to, for instance, the user's privileges.

section.title: Transformation
section.p:
Sort
Property Description
Sorting column Any attribute from the dataset or any computed column. If the table has group(s), this sorting applies only on leaf rows and not on group elements.
Sorting direction Ascending/descending.
The sort that appears at the top of the list will be executed first.

Table groups are summarized in a read-only list where limited number of properties are displayed. Group properties are editable by selecting the group item in the Editor area.
Property Description
Grouping column Any attribute from the dataset. The group will appear in the left column.
Sorting column The sorting of the grouping. This sorting orders elements of the current group.
Sorting direction Ascending/descending.

strow.stentry: The column on which the aggregation will appear.
List of available computations. This list varies depending on the rendering mode.
An attribute of the dataset used as the weight to compute the weighted mean. This property is editable only when the Aggregation Type is Weighted Mean; otherwise, it is undefined.
The result of the aggregation is displayed on a grouped row. You must choose at least one group on which to appear.

p.note: The aggregation of text value in a hierarchical context is not supported. This is a known limitation.

section.p:
You can define a filter that will remove rows from the table.
Property Description
Multiple keep filter logic You can define the filters that are combined using an OR or an AND.
Filter column Any attribute from the dataset.
Criteria The list of supported criteria is the following: =, <>, >, >=, <, <=, Like, Not Like.
Value The value to be matched.

The purpose of the "Extra" table is to add data that will not be displayed in the table model. The typical usage is to add IDs to build hyperlinks.
Property Description
Data Any attribute from the dataset.
